CAREER HONORS

2022 SEC First-Year Academic Honor Roll

CAREER

Speedy receiver entering his third year with the program in 2024 ... Saw action on special teams early in his career before developing into a consistent contributor in the rotation at receiver … Played in 15 career games with five starts and owns 19 catches for 194 yards with one touchdown.

2023 - RS-FRESHMAN

Played in all 13 games with five starts and hauled in 19 catches for 194 yards with one touchdown ... Made third consecutive start in UT’s Citrus Bowl win over No. 17 Iowa (1/1), finishing the game with two catches for 16 yards … Tallied four receptions for 37 yards in the regular season finale vs. Vanderbilt (11/25) ... Pulled in a career-best five catches for 44 yards in start vs. No. 1 Georgia (11/18) ... Logged a pair of catches for 17 yards in loss at No. 14 Missouri (11/11) ... Hauled in his first career touchdown in road win at Kentucky (10/28) with a wide-open 39-yard grab down the sideline in the second quarter ... Made second straight start at WR at No. 11/8 Alabama (10/21) ... Earned his first career start in win vs. Texas A&M (10/14) and had a career-best and team-high four catches for 31 yards ... Made his first career catch with a 10-yard grab in the fourth quarter in win vs. South Carolina (9/30) ... Played career-high 31 offensive snaps at wide receiver in win over UTSA (9/23) ... Played on special teams in win vs. Austin Peay (9/9) and at Florida (9/16) ... Played 22 offensive snaps at wide receiver in the season opener vs. Virginia (9/2) and also saw extensive action on special teams.

2022 - FRESHMAN

Redshirted … Appeared in two games but did not record any stats as a true freshman … Saw action on eight offensive snaps in regular-season finale at Vanderbilt (11/26) … Made his collegiate debut, playing 18 snaps in win over UT Martin (10/22).

HIGH SCHOOL

Speedy receiver and dual-sport standout for Bentonville High School in Northwest Arkansas … Enrolled at Tennessee in January 2022 and went through spring practice … Rated as a four-star prospect and the No. 36 wide receiver in the nation by On3.com … Rated a three-star wideout by 247Sports.com, Rivals and ESPN.com … A consensus top-10 player in the state of Arkansas by all major recruiting services … Ranked the No. 5 overall player in the state of Arkansas by Rivals.com and No. 9 by 247Sports.com … Led BHS to an 8-2 record in the 2021 regular season, hauling in 46 catches for 919 yards and 11 touchdowns … Took home all-state honors as a junior in 2020, racking up 34 catches for 772 yards and 12 touchdowns … Also ran track for BHS and set a school record on the 4x100-meter relay in April 2021 … Committed to the Vols in August 2021 … Chose Tennessee over 24 other Division I schools, including eight Power 5 institutions … Coached by Jody Grant.

PERSONAL

Full name is Charles Michael Nimrod … Goes by “Chas” … Born on July 30, 2003 … Son of Rebecca and Jonathan Nimrod … Majoring in hospitality and tourism management … X handle is @NimrodChas and Instagram handle is @chasnimrod.
